wikipedia_page.main: Richard Symonds (born 21 November 1959) is a former professional footballer. He played 63 times for Norwich City before moving into non-league football.

response: Richard Symonds (2 October 1918 – 15 July 2006) was an English academic and civil servant.
When the Japanese were threatening India with air raids, he was sent by the Friends' Ambulance to advise because of the expertise he had already gained.Who's Who entry for Richard Symonds
Richard Symonds served in the United Nations and was Resident Representative in various countries including Sri Lanka (then Ceylon), Greece, Yugoslavia and Tunisia.
*Richard Symonds (academic) (1918–2006), writer and United Nations development officer
